greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) = number of factorizations of (n,k) into pairs (i,j) with i > 0, j > 0 (and if i=1 then j=1).
formula: For n > 1, T(n,m) = ceiling((tau(n)-2)*tau(m)/2) + 1, where tau(n) = A000005(n). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 23 2010.
Dirichlet g.f.: A(s, t) = exp(B(s, t)/1 + B(2*s, 2*t)/2 + B(3*s, 3*t)/3 + ...) where B(s, t) = zeta(s)*(zeta(t)-1).
mathematica: rows = 14; t[n_, m_] := Ceiling[(DivisorSigma[0, n] - 2)*DivisorSigma[0, m]/2]+1; t[1, 1] = 1; t[1, _] = 0; ft = Flatten[ Table[ t[n-m+1, m], {n, 1, rows}, {m, n, 1, -1}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 18 2011, after _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_ *)
xref: Cf. A108461. Column 1: A001055. Main diagonal: A051707.
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 03 2005
